critique: The document is a formal approval of a Code of Fair Competition. The tone is official and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability in the government's actions. There is a slight sense of joy that the code has been approved and that the industry will be regulated fairly. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. There might be a slight surprise that the code has been approved so quickly.
